intro: Pseudopholidia brevifolia var. ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaved pseudopholidia, is a variant of the species native to tropical regions. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually clustered in inflorescences. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. The botanical description highlights its unique leaf morphology and ecological adaptations to its native environment.
